children.value: Create responsive maps using Vue.js components & composables
üèó ¬†Easily add Mapbox to your Nuxt app with Vue components
Easily create maps in your existing Nuxt 3 projects.
Create complex maps using familiar Vue.js syntax
Customize every part of Mapbox from any component
Add your Mapbox API key to the

html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}
Map instances are created with components. You can provide all the options through component props

props.code:
<MapboxMap
      map-id="{ID}"
      style="position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; left: 250px; width: 500px;"
      :options="{
        style: 'mapbox://styles/mapbox/light-v11', // style URL
        center: [-68.137343, 45.137451], // starting position
        zoom: 5 // starting zoom
      }"
    />

children.value: You can add Layers, Sources & Controls by nesting their respective components inside the Map

props.code:
<MapboxMap
      ...
    >
      <MapboxSource 
        source-id="{ID}"
        :source="{
          type: 'geojson',
          data: '/test.geojson'
        }"
      />
      <MapboxLayer
        :layer="{
          source: '{ID}',
          id: 'geojson-layer',
          type: 'fill'
        }"
      />
      <MapboxGeolocateControl position="top-left" />
    </MapboxMap>

. You must provide an API key here for maps to work.

are configured here. Any map specific properties can be set directly with
For map instances to be persistent across routes,

.
This is done by the module automatically, but you can disable it by setting the
to false will not have any effect, so if you need to have it disabled be sure to use
: True to enable with default, or object defining properties.
persistent?: Enable Map instances persist across routes. This just enables keepAlive. True by default
All Map events are accessible directly through the component (With full Typescript support!)

The simplest way to access the map instance on setup is with the useMapbox composable. You must provide the map id.
The map instance will not be available until the page is fully loaded, so you must access it through a callback.
NOTE: The callback will only be run after the map has loaded (so if you do
If you want to access the map before it has loaded, there is the
to ensure that your code gets run on reactive updates while the map is already loaded.
You can access your markers and popups in the same way as
When working with the map reactively (for example, in a watcher or computed method), you should instead use the map ref. The refs should be treated similar to Vue
It is important to remember that the refs will be undefined until they have been initialized, which will be after the component is mounted.

While it is recommended to use the default components, making your own is easy with the built in composables!

for custom marker & popup components
By passing a
you can put custom html directly into your component.
Be sure to nest your custom components inside a map instance so the map-id can be auto injected. You can also pass the map ID manually into the functions.
as a ref, the marker or popup will react to changes in settings.

props.code:
const popup = defineMapboxPopup(popupId, options, templateRef)
      popup?.setLngLat(lnglat)

children.value: NOTE: Because of the way markers are implemented in Mapbox, if passing a template ref to defineMapboxPopup you have to define properties in a callback like so:
You can make your own control with the defineMapboxControl composable.
If you would like to make your own map component, you can use

props.code:
// NOTE: Map instance will be null on server & until it is loaded on client
    const map = defineMapboxInstance(MAP_DIV_ID, options);

instead.
